name: Shades of Green Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Shades of Green for 5 nights while visiting Disney World. The number one compliment I have for this resort is how CLEAN it was. One of the restaurants was closed for renovations but the other one (the one with the buffet) was pretty good and decently priced. The service wasn't so great but it was a nice change from eating at the parks and spending a small fortune. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and hope that we get the chance to do so!
reviews.title: Shades of Green was perfect for our family!

reviews.text: This wonderful resort if for active or retired military personnel. We were sponsored by a family. You can sponsor up to 3 families. It was a fantastic trip. Across from the Polynesian hotel so you could ride the tram into Disney or shuttle service from the hotel to the parks. Casual dining option. Great breakfast buffet very reasonable. Pay no tax. Discount on park hopper pass. Clean rooms, friendly staff, nice pools, game room. We enjoyed this very much.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel at Disney

reviews.text: We just returned from a week vacation at Shades of Green/WDW. It was our first visit and we were pleasantly surprised. We did rent a car since unlike the Disney hotels, there isn't a free shuttle; but other than one quick trip to Publix and transportation to and from the airport, it wasn't really necessary. Warning, the parking spaces in the parking garage are very narrow; and if you do drive, request a room on the third floor or above for easy access to your car. We were on the first floor and that is the least convenient floor to access anything other than the pools or restaurants. The Shades of Green buses were prompt, clean and made getting to and from the parks worry free. The schedule for the buses are kept at the bus depot. I mention this because although I received a bus schedule when I checked in, my sister did not, and I stood in the reception line for 15 minutes waiting for a chance to talk to a clerk to get one for her only to be told they were kept by the buses. This was mildly frustrating because it was our first day; we were anxious to go the parks and because we waited so long, we just missed our bus.
reviews.title: A great place to stay when visiting WDW

reviews.text: The grounds are well kept, beautiful and peaceful. We caught the monorail at the Polynesian one day and that brief visit to the Polynesian was enough to make me appreciate the peacefulness of Shades of Green. The Polynesian, although very nice, was crowded and loud with people bustling everywhere. Another benefit to SOG, is the common thread all visitors have there. We all are connected to the military in one way or another and there is comfort in being among our military family.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.text: We ate breakfast in the Garden Gallery restaurant (buffet) most mornings. It was good, but lacked variety from one day to another, so at the end of the week it got a little boring. The weekend buffet was punched up a bit by adding an omlet station. It cost a little more ($10.95 versus $8.95), but was worth it. My omlet was made to order and very good. We only ate dinner there once, but it was okay. We each ordered a pasta dish and although tasty, they did not drain the pasta well so the sauce was watered down. The prices are very reasonable compared to the parks, and priced comparable to eating off property. We ordered room service once and "to-go" once, both were easy and the food was good. The lasagna from the quick service by the bus depot was excellent and highly recommended. Also the homemade ice cream in the ice cream parlor was excellent . We did not get anything from the sports bar by the pool, so I cannot review them, but it should be changing soon anyway. My understanding is when they finish redoing the italian restaurant which was closed when we were there, they will redo the sports bar. All in all, the restaurants are okay, and considering how tired you are when you return from the parks, they are a welcome relief to either driving off property or paying twice the price at the parks.
reviews.title: Great First Disney Experience!

reviews.text: We had a great stay over Christmas at SOG. The room was large and the only thing wrong was the view of the #1 tee outside of our balcony - wife insisted that I not play golf this vacation. Room was large and service was great. We had no trouble using the busses or Disney transportation. The coffee shop was convenient and the hotel business center was happy to help us check-in and print boarding passes for our flight home. SOG is a first class operation that I wish we had used earlier when our family was younger.
reviews.title: Fun stay at SOG

reviews.text: We stayed at Shades of Green January 11th to the 16th. We figured out that this is about our 12th stay at SOG. We had a room in the new wing. We always ask for this wing because it is close to the parking garage and we always have a rental car. We have not stayed in the Magnolia wing ever since the new wing opened. The rooms are large with 2 queen size beds and couch. There is a table with chairs. There are only 2 chairs, so we had to eat in shifts. Bathroom with 2 sinks and separate toilet and shower. We bought milk and donuts at the store. Room has a refrigerator. We had a balcony room overlooking the gazebo. We even got to watch a wedding. You do not need a rental car, but it does make it easy to run to the parks and stores. The buses run on time but they did not always follow our schedule. We usually drive to EPCOT, Studios and Animal Kingdom. We did use the bus to Downtown Disney, which was great because parking is terrible there. The room was very clean. The whole resort is very clean. The only food we ate there were hot dogs and ice cream from the ice cream parlor. If you are looking for that "Disney" feeling while you are there, you will not get it. The first time we stayed there (after staying at Disney resorts 4 times), I missed the Disney feeling. But now that we have stayed so many times, Shades of Green is like home. Everyone is so friendly. Everyone that stays there are special people. Beautiful grounds with lots of paths for walking. There is a microwave in the laundry room, so we made instant oatmeal and hot chocolate. Bring your own bowls and extra glasses. Only complaint is that we only get 2 glasses. Will stay there again.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay

reviews.text: Our family has stayed here many times! Spacious rooms are awesome. We have stayed on every level and in every hall way. Just a tip, on our last stay we had a handicap room (by coincidence) on the first level open to a nice grassy greenbelt, within view of the wood deck, and remote boats, etc. The kids loved this location where Grandma could sit on the patio with her coffee and the kids could run up and down the greenbelt and over to the deck! I thought, this is surely going to be on my room request list next time (to be on 1st floor on a green belt). It was also the same hallway as the arcade!
reviews.title: Awesome Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have never had any issues here. The resort is always quiet and relaxing!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel from 6 Dec 09 to 12 Dec 09. The hotel as well as the hotel grounds is very nice, neat, and clean. The hotel staff (including room cleaning personnel) is very attentive and helpful. The rooms are great! They are very clean and have a refrigerator. The rooms do not have a microwave oven or Internet service.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel with just a few minor issues....

reviews.text: My husband and i stayed at SOG for 5 nights--we sadly returned home last night. it was an incredible experience. i have to admit that i was somewhat hesitant of the hotel at first.... but because we went to WDW on a budget, SOG was a great place. we stayed in the newer section (closer to parking garage). the room was spacious and very clean!! transportation to and from parks very easy and right on time always!! very economical and quite a deluxe hotel. Very close to Magic Kingdom resorts and TTC. you can walk to polynesian for character breakfast. we did not eat at any of the buffet resturants on site. our last evening we ate at sports bar (evergreens). very good and prices were very resonable. very close to pool too. i would recommend SOG to anyone!! i was truly impressed!!!! A +++++ if you can qualify for the resort, you really must take advantage!!!
reviews.title: a great perk for military families visting WDW
Shades of Green Rocks!
reviews.text: My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Shades of Green, from the large, spacious rooms, the Magic Kingdom passes prices, the pools for kids and adults, easy access to the buses, food was great in all the restaurants and the convenience of the AFEES store. What's not to like??
Our stay at the Shades of Green hotel was wonderful. The location of the hotel was excellent (next to one of the Disney hotels). There was security at the gate, and parking was sheltered and secure.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel for DoD/Federal Employees
Will not stay here again
reviews.text: We arrived late one evening, and the staff at the restaurant went out of their way to serve us despite the late hour. We bought our Disneyworld/EPCOT tickets at the hotel (discounted). The room was large (2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa). We also tried the transportation provided by the hotel (to Disney and EPCOT), and they worked fine (on-time and well-marked bus).

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: If you are eligible to stay here, we highly recommend it.

I can honestly say, we have never had a vacation better than this one and our stay at Shades of Green was integral for us. We thought we'd lose out on the Disney experience staying at this resort. We thought we might be inconvenienced or treated like just another number like at guest lodging on different posts.
reviews.title: A Phenomenal Stay at SOG

reviews.text: We got here, we were GUESTS, not another military family looking for a deal. The place was gorgeous, the welcome warm, the excitement palpable. We received a packet of information just like all the other resorts give their guests. Our debit card was charged the entire amount of our room, but no big deal. We had planned this trip out precisely and had more than enough to cover it. And we had speedy check out available upon our departure because of it. Another hassle and line yet again avoided!
reviews.title: wonderful trip
Excellent hotel with great location and price
reviews.text: We get ready to hit our room, we peruse the lobby, the buildings, omgosh, this was not military thrown together. It was just as impressive as the other resorts we later visited and had dinner in. The carpetting, the interior, cozy yet large, upscale yet not enough that you are afraid to touch anything. The convention area, huge, lovely. I wish we could come out for a formal there!

reviews.title: Nice Hotel
reviews.text: Our room, large and cozy. We were five, including a teen who is bigger than us! He slept comfortably in the pullout. The little ones slept great in one bed, us in another. Bathroom was very nice, seperate his and hers sink, door seprating toilet and shower from sinks for the kiddies who insist on going when you are in the midst of beautifying ;)
The view we had, awesome. We chose a room nearer to the garage, overlooking the golf course grounds. Spectacular view and very quiet area of the hotel, unlike the mickey ears pool area.
reviews.title: Great place, can't beat the price

reviews.text: We stayed in April 2009 and had a great stay.The room's were clean and very large and the resort was family friendly and quiet..The buses ran on time however one day we walked to the Polynesian and took the monorail which was a nice change. I know that some people would prefer more Disney theming however I enjoyed the fact that after beeing in the parks all day it was nice to rest at a place that was not Disney 24/7. (However there are things to do still with the kids.) My only complaint at all is for the restaurant Manginos.Trying to get food to go is a nightmare..The staff was so busy talking to each other that the 3 times I tried to get food to go I had to flag somone down after 10 minutes of waiting.. They need some serious staff retraining in that restaurant..Other than that we are going back in April 2010 and cant wait...:-)
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back...

reviews.text: Just got back from our umpteenth visit to Shades of Green, and we continue to love going there. The only negative comment I might have is the consolidation of Mangino's and Evergreens restaurants. I think the result was not a good idea.
reviews.title: Don't miss it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the SoG in November. First, off, November was an excellent time to go to Disney World. The lines weren't that long at all, the crowds weren't bad, and the weather was still nice (80s all week). The SoG provided us with a wonderful place to stay while on our vacation to Disney. Our room had a great view of the surrounding forests and the golf course, which was pretty nice. The furniture in the rooms was a little dated, but comfortable nonetheless. The staff was excellent and the housekeeping services were very accomodating and kept the place very clean. With a resort on Disney, expect lots of families and kids and the like; everyone was super nice though and not overly noisy, which is appreciated. Would love to have had access to free internet / wifi, but I guess you can't get that everywhere. The shuttle bus services to the parks was absolutely great. On time, prompt, clean, and very manageable. Overall I enjoyed my stay on this wonderful property and would definitely recommend it and stay again sometime in the future!
reviews.title: Excellent resort for military!!!

reviews.text: Shades of Green was an affordable place for our extended family to stay in the off season. We had five rooms and they were all near each other. We were placed near the back of one wing and there it was quite a walk to the lobby however. I was able to do my laundry and it affordable. They have plenty of machines so you can knock it out quickly. We used the sidewalk to The Polyensian to catch the monorail to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. The bus schedule was on time to and back from Animal Kingdom and Disney Studios. The bus was crowded but we didn't have to wait in November. The kids enjoyed the heated Mickey pool. One suggestion is to bring all toiletries, only shampoo and liquid soap are available. I brought shampoo but wished I had brought bath soap as well. The pillows, matteress and sheets were very acceptable to us. We arrived early in the day, although our room was not ready, we were allowed to park in the parking deck and headed to Epcot. The same for checking out. We checked out early and left our cars in garage after our last park visit. The golf courses were closed due to the PGA tour event coming in the coming week so if golfing is on your to-do-list, you might ask to make sure the courses will be open. They have a no-tax store and a homemade ice cream parlor. We enjoyed our stay and felt we got our money's worth.
reviews.title: I would stay here again!
great great great
reviews.text: Been there from before the renovation, and everytime we been there had a greaty time. Easy access to all parks, great bus service. The only thing I wish they could improve would be the parking. The garage is too far,but still a great hotel, and the restaurants and ammendities are terrific
Shades of Green Review
reviews.title: Key Word - Value
Great Stay, Great Vacation!
reviews.text: The key word for this hotel is Value. Below I will list my pros and cons. The cons may paint an overly negative picture but they did not outweigh the positives, not by a long shot. We stayed at Shades of Green for seven nights and I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Loved Shades of Green
reviews.text: Pros:

reviews.title: a nice place, for a miliary hotel
reviews.text: Location – This hotel is one of the few located close to the Magic Kingdom. Located alongside the Magnolia and Palm golf courses the setting is beautiful. It is just a few minutes walk from the Polynesian (we walked there for a Character Breakfast and then caught the monorail).

reviews.title: The best!
reviews.text: Facility – The facility & landscaping are beautiful. The waterfalls in the front hide the bus loading area, the lobby is elegant without being overdone, and the common areas are kept clean.

reviews.title: Wonderful vacaion spot
reviews.text: Our son-in-law sponsored us for this vacation. SOG is a wonderful place and one of the cleanest hotels we have ever stayed in. This rates with 4-star hotels except you don't have all the amenities. If you want fancy go to one of the other Disney resorts - this is plain but quite nice - close enough to everything. Like others have said you may have to walk a distance to the parking garage or pool but consider the price. We would definately come back (do bring your own bar soap) :)
Our family learned about S.O.G. after staying at most of the hotels on
reviews.title: S.O.G. is definitely on the Mulhollem's list!
I loved SOG - it's peaceful, spacious, clean - and affordable!
reviews.text: Disney property, since we live in North Central Florida , and are Florida 'passholders' we 'Do the Mouse thing' often!

reviews.title: Amazing!!
reviews.text: We learned about Shades O' Green through a military site, since my husband is a 100% disabled Vietnam Vet we 'alerted' to the military

reviews.title: 5 Days is not enough at SOG
reviews.text: sound of the hotel. We thought it must be 'clean' and since you don't pay tax's while on the property that was a 'plus' for my husband (every penny counts when you are visiting D.World!)

We stayed at SOG for seven days. It was the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in. The rooms were huge and so comfortable--something that is greatly appreciated after a long day at Disney. We had a beautiful view of the golf course. The hotel was full, but we never heard a sound from the adjoining rooms. Staff and guests were incredibly friendly and helpful. We spent quite a bit of time at the pools and they were warm and comfortable, perfect for an afternoon break for our little ones. The hotel is very large so be prepared to walk quite a bit. The golf cart shuttle to the edge of the property saved us a 10 minute walk to the Polynesian, but we also used the SOG buses quite a bit and that was just fine too. The nightly buffet was a good value at $11.95, country, home-style food with a nice salad bar and fresh vegetables, a good dinner for our famiy. The Italian restaurant's pizza was so-so--it tasted like it was microwaved or reheated.
reviews.title: Wonderful, clean, spacious and relaxing resort!

reviews.text: The location is awesome. We walked around the Polynesian (kind of cheesy), the Grand Floridan (very stuffy and formal) and the Contemporary (looked like it hasn't been updated since 1980) and the SOG was by far the prettiest and most relaxing. I would go back again in a heartbeat! A wonderful vacation for military families!
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at SOG October 10-16. It was our first trip. Collectively, we had 3 rooms, 6 adults and 3 children (under the age of 4). SOG was worth every penny and then some. All 3 rooms were in the newly remodeled Magnolia section. Very nice. I travel for work and I would put SOG up against most Marriotts, Sheratons and Radissons I've stayed in. Very clean. Our room was quiet. The transportation shuttles were not that bad. However, we didn't know that DOT regs require you to collapse your stroller before boarding. My sister's stroller is quite big and difficult to collapse, so that was a bit of a pain. And I could see in the busy season why it would be difficult to take buses. They do fill up quickly in the morning, but we never had a problem. But overall, fantastic. The food at the buffet was good; breakfast was very good; dinner was good to tolerable. But, they didn't charge for the kids and we saved $$$ by not eating at Disney every meal; so we're not complaining. The AAFES store was very convenient; we bought Capri Suns every morning to take with us for the kids. All 3 of the pools were clean. We're definitely going again!
reviews.title: New management has ruined some of the best parts of the resort

reviews.text: We have visited the Shades several times in the past 15 years. We have always enjoyed our stay and loved the quiet and the location. The shuttles to the parks are also great. You can also monorail to the Polynesian and walk to the Shades. With this last visit from October 19-22, 2009, we found some very bad changes had been made. We have always enjoyed visiting "Evergreens", the sports bar/restaurant by the pool. It was one of the best parts of the resort and was always packed when we visited. The new management has gutted Evergreens, the place only serves hot dogs and PB&J sandwiches and some premade stuff. Just terrible. The Garden buffet was just OK and served the same food every night we were there. We ate at Mangino's, the Italian place and had the strangest experience we ever had in a restaurant. We both ordered pasta and were told that they no longer served any bread with meals. Now, there were plenty of dinner rolls in the Garden buffet, just across the hall. So, I got up and walked over and retrieved some dinner rolls myself. When other diners saw this, they also complained , and the manager obtained rolls for them from the buffet, following my example. We asked to speak to the manager and he refused to speak with us ... and he left the restaurant. Very bad customer service if you ask me. We ordered a take out pizza the next night from Manginos and it was not very good. Avoid this restaurant if you go to the Shades. The rooms were very big and had 2 large beds. We had room 155 near the Mill pool. It was first floor walk out to the pool, and was near the Arcade.We had a fridge but no microwave in our room. The only complaint I have about the rooms is that the shower was very difficult to trun on. You need to pull the handle out from the wall to get the water to come out. We tugged as hard as we could and finally got the thing to work. My husband also requested a humidifier for the room, but the request was ignored and no response was ever made to our request, So come to the Shades and visit the Guest relations office to urge them to restore Evergreens and get rid of this new management.
reviews.title: Loved the Shades of Green - Will go back soon!

reviews.text: Absolutely loved the Shades of Green. We stayed in the new section off of the golf course. Room was right by the parking garage so it was a short walk to the car. It's the best deal going for government or military employees. Always super clean and the staff is wonderful. You can walk across the street and take the monorail or it's a short drive to any of the parks.
reviews.title: A beautiful, full service hotel - don't let the value mislead you.

aka: Shades Of Green Resort Disney World
description: The Shades of Green Resort is a military-owned resort within Walt Disney World and is exclusively for military guests and their families. Information on eligibility and reservations can be found on the Shades of Green website.
